alert.note: Alert for Cayuga; Onondaga; Seneca (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 8:55AM EST until February 19 at 9:45AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Seneca County in central New York... Northwestern Cayuga County in central New York... Northwestern Onondaga County in central New York... * Until 945 AM EST. * At 855 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Fair Haven Beach State Park to near Rushville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Locations impacted include... Clay, Auburn, Lysander, Van Buren, Baldwinsville, Seneca Falls, Waterloo, Fayette, Owasco and Sennett. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 between 38 and 39, and near 41. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
